required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Hydrogels vs Silicone Hydrogel Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Hydrogels vs Silicone Hydrogel Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this fitting study is to evaluate the clinical performance of different hydrogel and silicone hydrogel contact lenses.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective Assessment: Change in Comfort and lens fit.
primary_outcome.description: Subjective Assessment: Comfort and Lens fit using questionnaire with Visual Analog Scale (0-100)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Practitioner Measurements: Change in Ocular response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at end of pair three
secondary_outcome.description: Objective Practitioner Measurements: Ocular response by Biomicroscopy Scale 0-4

arm_group.description: Day one - randomized lens pair 1 (ocufilcon D / ocufilcon D) , pair 2 (ocufilcon D / enfilcon A) or pair 3 (ocufilcon D / comfilcon A)
Day two - randomized lens pair 1 (metafilcon A / metafilcon A), pair 2 (metafilcon A / comfilcon A) or pair 3 (omafilcon A / comfilcon A)

intervention.description: Day one - randomized lens pair 1 (ocufilcon D / ocufilcon D) , pair 2 (ocufilcon D / enfilcon A) or pair 3 (ocufilcon D / comfilcon A)
Day two - randomized lens pair 1 (metafilcon A / metafilcon A), pair 2 (metafilcon A / comfilcon A) or pair 3 (omafilcon A / comfilcon A)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
A person is eligible for inclusion in the study if he/she:
- Is between 18 and 40 years of age (inclusive)
- Has had a self-reported visual exam in the last two years
- Is an adapted soft (contact lens) cl wearer
- Has a cl spherical prescription between -1.00 and -6.00 (inclusive)
- Has a spectacle cylinder up to 0.75D in each eye
- Is correctable to a visual acuity of 20/25 or better in both eyes
- Has clear corneas and no active ocular disease
- Has read, understood and signed the information consent letter
- Is willing to comply with the wear schedule
- Is willing to comply with the visit schedule
Exclusion Criteria:
A person will be excluded from the study if he/she:
- Has never worn contact lenses before
- Currently wears rigid gas permeable contact lenses
- Has a history of not achieving comfortable CL wear (5 days per week; > 8 hours/day)
- Has a CL prescription outside the range of -1.00 to -6.00D
- Has a spectacle cylinder â‰¥ 1.00D of cylinder in either eye
- Has best corrected spectacle distance vision worse than 20/25 in either eye
- Has any systemic or topical medications that will affect ocular health
- Has any ocular pathology or severe insufficiency of lacrimal secretion
- Has persistent, clinically significant corneal or conjunctival staining
- Has active neovascularization or any central corneal scars
- Is aphakic
- Is presbyopic
- Has undergone corneal refractive surgery
- Is participating in any other type of eye related conical or research study

facility.name: University of California, Berkeley Clinical Research Center (UCB-CRC)
